threatActors.name: Pro-Russian Hacktivist Group
threatActors.activity: PST kobler et dataangrep mot norske offentlige nettsider til prorussiske hacktivistgrupper. Angrepet ble raskt oppdaget og avverget, men understreker den fortsatte trusselen fra statsstøttede aktører.

keyTakeaways: Norge styrker cyberkompetansen gjennom øvelser og opplæring
Kritisk infrastruktur er sårbar på grunn av utdaterte systemer
Samarbeid mellom offentlig og privat sektor er essensielt
Kontinuerlig overvåking og rask respons er nødvendig
Modernisering av Altinn-plattformen forbedrer sikkerhet

Continue municipal training exercises
Upgrade legacy systems in critical infrastructure

Strengthen defenses against state-sponsored threats

incidents.target: Hundreds of women and minors in France
incidents.attackType: AI-generated deepfake abuse / Non-consensual intimate images
incidents.impact: Hundreds of victims (including minors) had "undressed" deepfake images created and shared
incidents.attribution: Abuse of Grok AI chatbot on X platform (Elon Musk's company)
incidents.status: Under investigation by French authorities; formal complaints filed

trends: AI-Generated Deepfake Abuse: The Grok deepfake incident represents a disturbing trend in AI-generated content being used for harassment and abuse. The ability to create realistic "undressed" images of real people, including minor...

Content Moderation Failures: The incident highlights failures in content moderation and safety filters for AI systems. Despite Grok's developers having safety measures in place, isolated failures allowed the generation of inappro...

Legal and Regulatory Response: French authorities' rapid response to the Grok deepfake incident demonstrates increasing regulatory scrutiny of AI platforms in the European Union. The formal complaints and expanded investigation sig...
legislation: French Legal Action: French lawmakers filed formal complaints on January 2, 2026, in response to the Grok deepfake incident. These complaints target both the creation and distribution of AI-generated non-consensual intima...

EU AI Regulations: The incident occurs in the context of the EU's evolving AI regulatory framework, including the AI Act which addresses high-risk AI systems. The creation of non-consensual intimate images using AI fall...

Content Moderation Requirements: EU digital services regulations, including the Digital Services Act (DSA), place obligations on platforms to moderate illegal content. The Grok deepfake incident may prompt additional scrutiny of AI-g...

threatActors.name: Malicious Grok Users
threatActors.activity: While not traditional cybercriminals or state-sponsored actors, individuals who abused the Grok AI system to create non-consensual intimate images represent a new category of digital threat actor. The

threatActors.name: Social Media Distributors
threatActors.activity: In addition to those creating the deepfake images, individuals who shared and distributed the images on social media platforms contributed to the harm. This distributed abuse pattern makes attribution

keyTakeaways: AI-generated deepfakes pose serious safety and ethical challenges
Content moderation filters for AI systems require continuous improvement
Legal frameworks must adapt to address AI-generated abuse
Platform providers bear responsibility for preventing harmful AI use
Protection of minors from AI-generated abuse is a critical priority
International cooperation is needed to address cross-border AI abuse

Implement robust verification before generating images of people
Enhance legal frameworks for AI-generated content abuse

incidents.impact: Multiple ransomware attacks executed by two U.S. cybersecurity professionals
3.4GB of data exfiltrated; breach confirmed by company

incidents.status: Breach notification updated; patient notifications underway

Ransomware Targeting Critical Services: Both Sedgwick (a major claims administrator serving federal contractors) and Covenant Health (a large healthcare provider) were hit by sophisticated ransomware groups. These incidents demonstrate that...

Healthcare Sector Vulnerabilities: The healthcare sector remains under siege, with Covenant Health's breach affecting 478,188 individuals. The attribution to Qilin ransomware group shows that established ransomware-as-a-service operati...

threatActors.name: BlackCat/ALPHV

threatActors.name: TridentLocker

threatActors.name: Qilin
threatActors.activity: The Qilin ransomware group was attributed to the Covenant Health breach that occurred in July 2025. The group's successful attack resulted in the exposure of nearly half a million patient records, mak

keyTakeaways: Insider threats from compromised cybersecurity professionals pose a significant risk
Healthcare remains the most targeted sector for ransomware attacks
Ransomware groups continue to use double-extortion tactics (data theft + encryption)
Federal contractors handling sensitive government data are prime targets
Organizations must improve breach detection and response times

incidents.target: Manage My Health (New Zealand patient portal)
incidents.impact: ~126,000 patients affected (~6-7% of 1.8M users); private health documents accessed
incidents.status: Under investigation; GP practices identified; patient notifications underway
